There are 3 categories of [[State of apparent death SD-038|organ donors]] :

*donors in a state of brain death, who represent the majority of donors;
*donors who have died after circulatory arrest (DCAD). A distinction is made between donors who have suffered an "uncontrolled" out-of-hospital cardiac arrest and donors who have suffered a circulatory arrest in intensive care following a decision to stop active treatment;
*Living donors.

properties.question: What are the three categories of organ donors?
properties.option_a: Donors in a state of brain death, donors who have died after circulatory arrest (DCAD), and donors who have suffered an 'uncontrolled' out-of-hospital cardiac arrest
properties.option_b: Donors in a state of brain death, donors who have died after circulatory arrest (DCAD), and living donors
properties.option_c: Donors in a state of cardiac arrest, donors who have died after circulatory arrest (DCAD), and living donors
properties.option_d: Donors in a state of brain death, donors who have died after circulatory arrest (DCAD), and donors who have suffered a circulatory arrest in intensive care following a decision to stop active treatment
